newsitem.title: CHINA: CHINA INDUSTRIAL WORKFORCE TOTALS 146.71 MILLION.
newsitem.headline: CHINA INDUSTRIAL WORKFORCE TOTALS 146.71 MILLION.

text.p: China's industrial workforce totalled 146.71 million at the end of June, down by 186,000 compared with the previous year, the China Daily said on Monday.
Of that total, 108.49 million workers were employed by the state sector, it said quoting a report by the Ministry of Labour.

It gave no figures for urban unemployment, which officials say is about 3.0 percent. But Chinese academics say the real figure is closer to 7.5 percent as surplus workers and those laid-off without pay are included.
The average wage was 2,904 yuan ($349) in the first six months of the year, representing real growth of 5.1 percent compared with the year-ago period, it said.
The total payment to the workforce reached 427.99 billion yuan by end-June, up 9.9 percent compared with the year-ago period, it said.
